details.title: Not collecting CDRs of patients but details of tower locations: Kerala Police
details.content: The Opposition Congress had yesterday slammed the ruling Left over its decision to allow police to use the CDRs of COVID-19 patients for effective contact tracing, saying it was an "infringement" on the privacy of citizens and the state cannot be allowed to be converted into a "Police State." (READ FULL HIGHLIGHTS HERE)

details.title: 2,706 new cases in Assam
details.content: 2,706 COVID cases detected out of 49,603 tests conducted in Assam in the last 24 hours, taking total cases to 74,501 including 49,383 recovered cases, 24,940 active cases and 175 deaths: State Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma.

Kerala: Thiruvananthapuram Disaster Management Authority issues guidelines for re-opening of gyms, salons and beauty parlours. Gyms will need to provide oximeters to record oxygen saturation and salons will need to adopt token system of appointment for stagger client entry. pic.twitter.com/WtY8Z4opkV

— ANI (@ANI) August 14, 2020

details.title: Karnataka reduces testing charges
details.content: RTPCR testing rate for patients referred from government hospitals to private labs has been reduced from Rs 2,000 to Rs 1,500. If tests are conducted directly in private labs, rates charged would be reduced from Rs 3,000 to Rs 2,500: Karnataka Deputy CM CN Ashwathnarayan.

details.title: India's COVID graph maintains its higher trajectory
details.content: Spike of 65,002 cases and 996 deaths reported in India, in the last 24 hours.The COVID-19 tally in the country rises to 25,26,193 including 6,68,220 active cases, 18,08,937 discharged/migrated and 49,036 deaths: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.

— ANI (@ANI) August 15, 2020

details.title: Mass production of COVID-19 vaccine to begin in India once scientists give nod: PM
details.content: Addressing the nation from the ramparts of the Red Fort on India's 74th Independence Day, Modi said three vaccine candidates are in different stages of trials in the country, adding the talent of our scientists is like that of 'rishi munis'. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: 65,002 fresh cases take India's COVID-19 tally past 25 lakh mark, recovery rate nears 72 per cent
details.content: According to figures from the ministry, 18.08 lakh people have so far recuperated from the disease, pushing the recovery rate to 71.61 per cent. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Independence Day celebrations in Sardar Patel COVID Care Centre
details.content:
Delhi: Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) personnel and #COVID19 patients celebrate #IndependenceDay at 10,000-bedded Sardar Patel COVID Care Centre and Hospital, Radha Soami Beas, Chhatarpur. pic.twitter.com/7MkuraQdfu

— ANI (@ANI) August 15, 2020

details.title: Kejriwal lauds Delhi residents for efficient handling of COVID-19
details.content: Today COVID situation is very much under control in Delhi. I congratulate people of Delhi. They have done phenomenal work in past few years. In last five years when pollution was increasing everywhere, Delhi was probably the only city where people helped decrease it by 25 per cent: Delhi CM.

details.title: Researchers identify 73 novel variants of COVID-19 strain in Odisha
details.content: "The research team, which carried out sequencing of 1,536 samples including 752 clinical samples, reported two lineages -- B.1.112 and B.1.99 -- for the first time in India," Dr Jayashankar Das, lead investigator and director (research) of the IMS and SUM Hospital, said on Friday. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: COVID-19: Will not open schools in Delhi unless fully convinced, says Kejriwal
details.content: Delivering his Independence Day speech at Delhi Secretariat, Kejriwal said the COVID-19 situation in the national capital is under control as compared to what it was two months back and thanked all the stakeholders, including the central government, 'corona warriors' and different organisations. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: The COVID19 tally in the country reaches 25,26,193
details.content: The COVID19 tally in the country rises to 25,26,193 including 6,68,220 active cases, 18,08,937 discharged/migrated & 49,036 deaths: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.

details.title: CSIR head on vaccine trials in India
details.content: Essential thing about this is that Indian scientists aren't behind in fight against Corona. As per my knowledge, candidates are by Zydus Cadila, Serum Institute- collaborating with Oxford University and Bharat Biotech. I expect next few months to be crucial: Shekhar Mande, DG, CSIR.

details.title: 1,863 COVID19 cases and 10 deaths reported in Telangana
details.content:
1,863 #COVID19 cases and 10 deaths reported in Telangana as of 8 pm on 14th August. The total number of cases in the State rises to 90,259 including 66,196 recovered cases and 684 deaths: Government of Telangana pic.twitter.com/cgN0ymWygw

— ANI (@ANI) August 15, 2020

details.title: Scientists identify potential drug candidate against COVID-19
details.content: Using state-of-the-art computer simulations, scientists have identified a preexisting drug, used to treat multiple diseases, including bipolar disorders and hearing loss, that could prevent the novel coronavirus from replicating in host cells, an advance that may lead to a therapeutic solution against COVID-19. The study, published in the journal Science Advances, assessed the molecule main protease, Mpro, of the novel coronavirus which is a key enzyme that plays a central role in its life cycle.

details.title: Sikki and Kiran return negative in second COVID-19 tests, national badminton camp to resume on Monday
details.content: Shuttler N Sikki Reddy and physiotherapist Kiran Challagundla on Saturday returned negative for COVID-19 in a second round of tests, clearing the decks for resumption of the national badminton camp in Hyderabad from Monday.

details.title: Bihar updates
details.content: Bihar detects 3,536 more COVID19 positive cases in the last 24 hours. Active cases in the state stand at 36,237: State Health Department

details.title: Record 57,381 COVID-19 patients discharged in a day: Health ministry
details.content: The number of people in India who have recuperated from COVID-19 went past 18 lakh on Saturday with a record 57,381 patients discharged in 24 hours pushing the recovery rate to 71. 61 per cent, according to the health ministry data. India's 'test, track and treat' strategy has achieved another peak with 8,68,679 COVID-19 tests done in a 24 hours taking the cumulative tests done till Friday to more than 2. 85 crore, the ministry said.

details.title: Maharashtra minister Balasaheb Patil tests positive for coronavirus
details.content: Maharashtra Cooperation Minister Balasaheb Patil has tested positive for coronavirus infection and is undergoing treatment at a hospital in Karad. According to a statement issued by Patil's office, the NCP leader tested positive for the infection on Friday night and has been admitted to Krushna Hospital in Karad.

details.title: Playback Singer SP Balasubrahmanyam still on life support
details.content:
Playback Singer SP Balasubrahmanyam (in file pic) who had been admitted at MGM Healthcare for symptoms of #COVID19 since 5th August, continues to be on life support in ICU. He remain stable & doctors closely monitoring his clinical parameters: MGM Healthcare, Chennai. #TamilNadu pic.twitter.com/AxD8TPskiG

— ANI (@ANI) August 15, 2020

details.title: Government of Manipur extends complete lockdown in the state till 31st August
France declares Paris, Marseille as high-risk zone for coronavirus
details.content: Paris and the Bouches-du-Rhone area around Marseille are classified as high-risk zone for coronavirus infection, said a government decree, a move that enables authorities to toughen restriction rules.

details.title: Rajasthan: 686 fresh COVID-19 cases, 13 deaths
details.content: Rajasthan recorded 686 fresh coronavirus cases and 13 deaths due to the disease on Saturday, taking the state's infection tally to 59,378. The COVID-19 death toll in the state stands at 859, officials said.

details.title: Courts to open in Delhi from September 1
details.content:
Delhi High Court plans to open courts from September 1,
subject to complete availability of public transport and subject to #COVID19 situation in Delhi: Delhi High Court official pic.twitter.com/xmoBwNrmnj

— ANI (@ANI) August 15, 2020

details.title: Home isolation helped save beds, aided in fight against COVID-19, says Delhi CM
details.content: In case of Delhi, home isolation was a measure that helped us in fighting the battle against COVID19. For instance, if there are 10,000 cases, only 1000 are severe&taken to hospitals, the remaining get cured at home. It saves 9000 beds, this can be followed in villages: Delhi CM

details.content: WHO chief scientist Soumya Swaminathan conferred with Tamil Nadu CM's special award in recognition of her advisory role in combating COVID-19 pandemic in the state.

details.title: Kerala reports 1608 new cases

1608 new #COVID19 positive cases have been reported in Kerala today. Number of active cases now at 14891, so far 27779 patients have recovered: Health Department, Kerala

— ANI (@ANI) August 15, 2020

details.title: Kejriwal urges people to donate oximeters to help villages fight virus
details.content: Oximeters help in measuring the oxygen level and are found to be extremely useful for coronavirus patients who in many cases battle breathlessness due to lack of oxygen. In his address to AAP volunteers, Kejriwal said lives of people can be saved through these oximeters.(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: 532 new cases in Jammu and Kashmir
details.content:
532 new #COVID19 positive cases, 734 recoveries & 7 deaths reported in Jammu and Kashmir today. Total number of cases rise to 28021: Govt of J&K pic.twitter.com/xQybiWECFU

— ANI (@ANI) August 15, 2020

details.title: 64 new COVID-19 cases in Meghalaya; tally rises to 1,292
details.content: Meghalaya reported 64 fresh COVID-19 cases on Saturday, taking the northeastern state's tally to 1,292 officials said. Health Services director Aman War said 34 COVID-19 cases were detected in West Garo Hills district that includes eight Border Security Force (BSF) troopers.

details.title: Once we get vaccine, COVID warriors will be first ones to get dose: MoS Health Ashwini Kumar Choubey
details.content: Scientists are working hard on coronavirus vaccine and if their efforts bear fruit, COVID-19 warriors will be the first ones to get the dose, Union Minister of State for Health Ashwini Kumar Choubey said on Saturday.

details.title: 102 new COVID-19 cases push tally to 6,408 in Noida
details.content: Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddh Nagar on Saturday recorded 102 new COVID-19 cases, pushing the district's tally to 6,408, official data showed. The number of active cases in the district stood at 867, up from 826 on Friday, according to the data released by the UP Health Department for a 24-hour period.

details.title: Andhra Pradesh records 8,732 new coronavirus cases, 87 deaths
details.content: Andhra Pradesh's COVID-19 infection positivity rate crossed the 10 per cent mark on Saturday as the states aggregate number of cases reached 2,81,817, with the addition of 8,732 in the last 24 hours. The latest bulletin said after a cumulative 28,12,197 sample tests, the infection positivity rate touched 10.02 per cent, the highest so far.

details.title: Uttar Pradesh's COVID-19 caseload rises to 1,50,061; death toll mounts to 2,393
details.content: The COVID-19 death toll in Uttar Pradesh on Saturday reached 2,393 with 58 more fatalities, while 4,774 fresh cases took the state's infection tally to 1,50,061. A total of 96,231 people have been discharged from hospitals after recovering from the disease.

details.title: COVID-19 tally in Himachal Pradesh crosses 3,900-mark with 33 fresh cases
details.content: The COVID-19 tally in Himachal Pradesh reached 3,908 on Saturday with 33 more people testing positive for the disease, an official said. There are 1,274 active cases in the state, while a total of 2,580 patients have recovered from the infection so far, Additional Chief Secretary (Health) R D Dhiman said.

details.title: 1,094 new COVID-19 cases take tally to 77,663 in Gujarat; 19 die
details.content: Gujarat's COVID-19 tally went up to 77,663 on Saturday with addition of 1,094 new cases, state health department said. Cumulative fatalities rose by 19 to to 2,767, it said.

details.title: Kerala reports highest single day spike of 1608 COVID-19 cases
details.content: Kerala on Saturday reported the highest single day spike of 1,608 COVID-19 cases, including 31 health workers, taking the the tally to 42,885, while seven deaths took the total number of fatalities to 146.

details.title: Mizoram's COVID-19 tally rises to 713
details.content: Fifty-six more people tested positive for COVID-19 in Mizoram on Saturday, taking the northeastern state's caseload to 713, officials said. The new cases were reported from Aizawl (27), Kolasib (26) and Lunglei district three, they said.

details.title: Nagpur records 733 new COVID-19 cases, 14 deaths
details.content: As many as 733 persons tested positive for coronavirus infection and 14 succumbed to it Maharashtra's Nashik district on Saturday, a district official said. With the detection of 733 new cases, the district's COVID-19 tally now stands at 13,478, the official said.

details.title: 162 new coronavirus cases in Ahmedabad, 3 deaths, 188 recover
details.content: Ahmedabad reported 162 new coronavirus patients on Saturday, raising the district's case tally to 28,840, the Gujarat health department said. The COVID-19 death toll in the district rose to 1,655 with three new fatalities, it said.

details.title: Delhi records 1,276 fresh COVID cases, ten new fatalities
details.content: Delhi recorded 1,276 fresh coronavirus cases on Saturday, taking the caseload to over 1.51 lakh, while the death toll rose to 4,188 with ten new fatalities, authorities said.

details.title: Sikkim reports 68 fresh COVID-19 cases
details.content: Sikkim on Saturday reported 68 new COVID-19 cases, taking the Himalayan state's tally to 1,148, an official said. Director General (DG)-cum-Secretary, Health, Dr Pempa T Bhutia said that South Sikkim reported 41 positive cases and East Sikkim 27 cases.

details.title: Chandigarh reports 81 new COVID-19 cases
details.content: Chandigarh on Saturday reported 81 fresh coronavirus cases, including that of four minors, taking the city's tally to 2,009, as per a medical bulletin. The death toll in the Union Territory stands at 28.

details.title: Record 40 fatalities push COVID-19 death toll in Punjab to 771
details.content: The COVID-19 death toll in Punjab reached 771 on Saturday with a record 40 fatalities, while 1,033 new cases took the infection tally to 30,041, according to a medical bulletin.

details.title: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal invites 7 corona warriors to I-Day function
details.content: It was a proud moment for seven COVID warriors who were invited to the Delhi government's Independence Day function, as Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal praised them for their work during the pandemic.

details.title: Tripura reports 167 new COVID-19 cases, four more deaths
details.content: Tripura on Saturday reported 167 fresh COVID-19 cases, taking the state's tally to 6,952, while the death toll reached 50 as four more patients succumbed to the disease, a health department official said.

details.title: West Bengal's COVID-19 tally jumps to 1,13,432 with record 3,074 fresh cases
details.content: West Bengal reported its highest single-day spike of 3,074 COVID-19 cases on Saturday, pushing the tally in the state to 1,13,432, the health department said. The death toll climbed to 2,377 after 58 more patients succumbed to the virus, it said in a bulletin.

details.title: 12,614 new coronavirus cases in Maharashtra, 322 deaths
details.content: Maharashtra's coronavirus case tally increased to 5,84,754 on Saturday with the addition of 12,614 new cases, the state health department said. With 322 COVID-19 patients dying during the day, the death toll due to the pandemic rose to 19,749, the department said.

details.title: 10 more COVID deaths in Haryana, 796 fresh cases
details.content: Ten more deaths due to COVID-19 were reported in Haryana on Saturday, while 796 fresh cases took the state's caseload to 46,410, the health department said.

details.title: Maharashtra has become COVID capital of India: Devendra Fadnavis​​​​​​​
details.content: Citing the surge in COVID-19 cases and fatalities in Maharashtra, senior BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on Saturday termed the state as the "COVID capital" of the country. He stressed that testing need to be ramped up to check the spread of coronavirus and to bring the fatality rate under control.

details.title: Uttarakhand reports 325 fresh COVID-19 cases
details.content: A total of 325 people tested positive for COVID-19 in Uttarakhand on Saturday, taking the infection tally to 11,940 while the death toll rose to 151 with four more fatalities, according to the health department's bulletin.

details.title: 1,019 new coronavirus cases in Madhya Pradesh, 13 deaths, 948 recover
details.content: Madhya Pradesh on Saturday saw its single-day highest spike of 1,019 coronavirus cases, taking the total count to 44,433, state health officials said. The coronavirus death toll rose to 1,094 after 13 patients succumbed to the viral infection since Friday evening, officials said.

details.title: Goa's COVID-19 tally rises by 369 to 11,339; five die
details.content: Goa's COVID-19 case count rose by 369 to 11,339 on Saturday, while five deaths took toll to 98, the state health department said. A total of 331 patients were discharged in the day, taking the number of recoveries to 7,488.

details.title: Nagaland reports 18 new COVID-19 cases
details.content: Nagaland on Saturday reported 18 new COVID-19 cases while 123 people recovered from the disease in the state, officials said. With the 18 new COVID-19 cases, the state's tally rose to 3,340 of which 2,005 are active cases, according to data released by Additional Director of Health and Family Welfare, Dr Denis Hangsing.

details.title: Amravati's COVID-19 cases rise by 129 to 3,687
details.content: The number of COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra's Amravati district went up by 129 to 3,687 on Saturday, officials said. Significantly, 129 patients were also discharged in the day, taking the number of recoveries to 2,496.

details.title: 12,614 new coronavirus cases in Maharashtra, 322 deaths, 6,844 recover
details.content: Maharashtra's coronavirus case tally increased to 5,84,754 on Saturday with the addition of 12,614 new cases, the state health department said. With 322 COVID-19 patients dying during the day, the death toll due to the pandemic rose to 19,749, the department said.

details.title: Assam's COVID death toll rises to 182, tally reaches 74,501
details.content: The COVID-19 death toll in Assam rose to 182 after seven people succumbed to the disease on Saturday, while the number of the state's coronavirus caseload has gone up to 74,501, Health and Family Welfare Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said.

details.title: Lockdown extended in Manipur till August 31 amid rising COVID-19 cases
details.content: The Manipur government on Saturday extended the complete lockdown till August 31 to contain the spread of COVID-19 in the state, where 192 more people tested positive, pushing the tally to 4,390.

details.title: Biggest single-day spike of 8,818 new cases in Karnataka
details.content: Karnataka on Saturday reported the biggest single-day spike of over 8,800 new cases of COVID-19 and 114 related fatalities. With this, the total number of infections rose to 2,19,926 and death toll to 3,831 in the state, the health department said.

details.title: Chhattisgarh: 428 new COVID-19 cases, 4 deaths, 189 recoveries
details.content: With 428 new COVID-19 cases and four deaths, Chhattisgarh's case count rose to 14,987 and death toll to 134 on Saturday, a health official said. Three patients died on Friday while the information about a death that took place at a private hospital here on August 12 was received on Saturday, he said.

details.title: 2,432 new coronavirus cases in Pune district, 62 deaths
details.content: Pune district reported 2,432 new coronavirus cases on Saturday, taking its case count to 1,22,397, a health official said on Saturday. The death toll in the district reached 2,957 with 62 persons succumbing to the infection during the day.
